intro: Calymmostachya modesta, commonly known as the modest calymmostachya, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
